main event: A single white round light, the size of a basketball at arm's length, was observed in the sky over Liberty, Pennsylvania on January 19, 1957.
interesting points: The object was first seen at 20 degrees elevation and 330 degrees azimuth, and disappeared at 10 degrees elevation and 90 degrees azimuth, traveling in a southeasterly direction.
The object appeared to roll as it approached the far end of its flight path.
Four white trails were visible until the object was almost out of sight, then four more were visible.
The object was observed visually for 3 to 5 minutes.
The report concludes that the sighting was probably caused by a high-flying B-52 in the area.
sighted object: a single white round light, the size of a basketball at arm's length
